1.brief: properly, instrumental music; by implication, a poem set to notes
David, the youngest son of Jesse
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
intercession, supplication; by implication, a hymn
to broaden out the ear (with the hand), i.e. (by implication) to listen
near, with or among; often in general, to
literally firmness; figuratively security; morally fidelity
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)

2.brief: not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be (causatively, make) right (in a moral or forensic sense)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively

3.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to run after (usually with hostile intent; figuratively (of time) gone by)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
to crumble; transitively, to bruise (literally or figuratively)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
to die (literally or figuratively); causatively, to kill
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always

4.brief: to shroud, i.e. clothe (whether transitive or reflex.); hence (from the idea of darkness) to languish
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
a bisection, i.e. (by implication) the centre
to stun (or intransitively, grow numb), i.e. devastate or (figuratively) stupefy (both usually in a passive sense)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

5.brief: properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
the front, of place (absolutely, the fore part, relatively the East) or time (antiquity); often used adverbially (before, anciently, eastward)
to murmur (in pleasure or anger); by implication, to ponder
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
to ponder, i.e. (by implication) converse (with oneself, and hence, aloud) or (transitively) utter

6.brief: a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

7.brief: properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to hide (by covering), literally or figuratively
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
to liken, i.e. (transitively) to use figurative language (an allegory, adage, song or the like); intransitively, to resemble
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
a pit hole (especially one used as a cistern or a prison)

8.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
near, with or among; often in general, to
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

9.brief: to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, to plump, i.e. fill up hollows; by implication, to cover (for clothing or secrecy)

10.brief: properly, to goad, i.e. (by implication) to teach (the rod being an Oriental incentive)
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
to guide; by implication, to transport (into exile, or as colonists)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

a level, i.e. a plain (often used (with the article prefix) as a proper name of certain districts); figuratively, concord; also straightness, i.e. (figuratively) justice (sometimes adverbially, justly)

11.brief: properly, heed, i.e. purpose; used only adverbially, on account of (as a motive or an aim), teleologically, in order that
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to live, whether literally or figuratively; causatively, to revive
rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
tightness (i.e. figuratively, trouble); transitively, a female rival:
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

12.brief: kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to cramp, literally or figuratively, transitive or intransitive
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
